DataElement.preferredDefinition: A textual description of the bone location of the sarcoma.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the location of a sarcoma in a bone.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A usually aggressive malignant mesenchymal cell tumor most commonly arising from muscle, fat, fibrous tissue, bone, cartilage, and blood vessels.  Sarcomas occur in both children and adults.  The prognosis depends largely on the degree of differentiation (grade) of the tumor.  Representative subtypes are liposarcoma, leiomyosarcoma, osteosarcoma, and chondrosarcoma. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A usually aggressive malignant neoplasm of the soft tissue or bone. It arises from muscle, fat, fibrous tissue, bone, cartilage, and blood vessels. Sarcomas occur in both children and adults. The prognosis depends largely on the degree of differentiation (grade) of the neoplasm. Representative subtypes are liposarcoma, leiomyosarcoma, osteosarcoma, and chondrosarcoma.

Property.preferredDefinition: Bone; a rigid connective tissue that makes up the skeleton of vertebrates.:A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

Concepts.definition: The structural organ comprised of specialized connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.
A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

Sarcomas occur in both children and adults. The prognosis depends largely on the degree of differentiation (grade) of the neoplasm. Representative subtypes are liposarcoma, leiomyosarcoma, osteosarcoma, and chondrosarcoma._Named locations of or within the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.

Concepts.definition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having to do with metastasis, which is the spread of cancer from the primary site (place where it started) to other places in the body.

Concepts.definition: A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
